org.strongback.components

Interface Relay


  • @ThreadSafe
public interface Relay
    A relay is a device that can be turned on and off. Note that a relay has one of 5 possible states:
    1. ON - the relay is in the "on" position;
    2. OFF - the relay is in the "off" position;
    3. SWITCHING_ON - the relay was in the "off" position but has been changed and is not yet in the "on" position;
    4. SWITCHING_OFF - the relay was in the "on" position but has been changed and is not yet in the "off" position; and
    5. UNKNOWN - the relay position is not known

    Not all Relay implementations use all relay states. Very simple relays that have no delay will simply only use Relay.State.ON and Relay.State.OFF, while relays that have some delay might also use Relay.State.SWITCHING_ON and Relay.State.SWITCHING_OFF. Those relay implementations that may not know their position upon startup may start out in the UNKNOWN state.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Relay fixed(Relay.State state)
      Obtain a relay that remains in one fixed state, regardless of any calls to on() or off().
      static Relay instantaneous(Consumer<Boolean> switcher, BooleanSupplier onState)
      Obtain a relay that instantaneously switches from one state to another using the given functions.
      default boolean isOff()
      Check whether this relay is known to be off.

    • Method Detail

      • state

        Relay.State state()
        Get the current state of this relay.
        Returns:
        the current state; never null

      • on

        Relay on()
        Turn on this relay.
        Returns:
        this object to allow chaining of methods; never null

      • off

        Relay off()
        Turn off this relay.
        Returns:
        this object to allow chaining of methods; never null

      • isOn

        default boolean isOn()
        Check whether this relay is known to be on. This is equivalent to calling state() == State.ON.
        Returns:
        true if this relay is on; or false otherwise

      • isOff

        default boolean isOff()
        Check whether this relay is known to be off. This is equivalent to calling state() == State.OFF.
        Returns:
        true if this relay is off; or false otherwise

      • isSwitchingOn

        default boolean isSwitchingOn()
        Check if this relay is switching on. This is equivalent to calling state() == State.SWITCHING_ON.
        Returns:
        true if this relay is in the process of switching from off to on; or false otherwise

      • isSwitchingOff

        default boolean isSwitchingOff()
        Check if this relay is switching off. This is equivalent to calling state() == State.SWITCHING_OFF.
        Returns:
        true if this relay is in the process of switching from on to off; or false otherwise

      • fixed

        static Relay fixed(Relay.State state)
        Obtain a relay that remains in one fixed state, regardless of any calls to on() or off().
        Parameters:
        state - the fixed state; may not be null
        Returns:
        the constant relay; never null

      • instantaneous

        static Relay instantaneous(Consumer<Boolean> switcher,
                           BooleanSupplier onState)
        Obtain a relay that instantaneously switches from one state to another using the given functions.
        Parameters:
        switcher - the function that switches the state, where true represents Relay.State.ON and false represents Relay.State.OFF; may not be null
        onState - the function that returns true if the current state is Relay.State.ON, or false otherwise; may not be null
        Returns:
        the relay; never null
